1.content: Okay so to start off you have just been thrown through a portal after being knocked out just moments before and shoved in a sac. When you wake you find yourself in a place full of ponies. That's not what surprised you most. You came to see you are a pony yourself and a child at that, which was what you were before hand, er, hoof in this case, but are you a colt or a filly. (You can choose a name for your character in later chapters.)
1.title: It begins where you are in Equestria

11.content: Are you a colt or will you stay human?
11.title: Colt.

111.content: Are you a unicorn, pegasus. or regular pony?
111.title: Colt

1111.content:
Red text is text that can be skipped if you just want a really quick read. This is not recommended.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------

You weren't woken by the crackling of the balls of plasma as they racked the Earth, or the roaring of the trees as they were torn from their roots and tossed into the air by the kinetic energy. No, no. After 36 hours in what can be described as almost a comatose state, it instead was the serene sounds of the surrounding forest that finally roused you from your slumber. Gradually, upon waking, you were racked with a sensation unlike any you've felt before.

You were no stranger to the sensation of phantom limbs- you've had your share of bad trips before. This, however, was something different entirely. The moment you were conscious enough to comprehend it, you were paralyzed by the sensation that you body isn't what it used to be. It felt like a twisted malformation of what it once was, with not a single limb familiar to you. You didn't dare open your eyes or move a muscle, to avoid spoiling the sensation, which was actually rather pleasant, if only for it's novelty.

As your senses returned to you, you became more aware of your surroundings. You could hear wind blowing through a field of tall grass, birds chirping in the trees, and you could feel the grass brushing against the limbs you used to be sure were just illusions. None of it was familiar to you- your last memory was of you in bed in an apartment far, far away from any forests. You were hit by a wave of deep concern. Could you be dreaming? It was so vivid!

Hesitantly, you cracked open an eyelid, praying for it all to have been a dream and, for the first time in your life, actually wanting to be back in your shitty apartment in Kansas City. As your eyes adjust to the brightness, the latter of your suspicions were confirmed. You were in a small outcropping of grass in what looked like a dense forest. In the center of the outcropping was a large circular hole- a crater, as if a sizable explosion had wrecked the place.

As you looked down at your body, your soul was gripped with dread at what you might find. What you saw was, perhaps, the last thing you expected. You yourself didn't believe it at first. You looked like some kind of horse-like creature, but not exactly like any horse you'd ever seen. Doing a double-take, you wriggle your limbs a little bit. You recognized, subconsciously, that you arms were gone- they'd been replaced with what seemed like a second pair of legs. The legs were difficult to really bend as much as you were used to, and you didn't seem to have any feet. You could feel two extra limbs on your 'back' as well, but you didn't know what they were supposed to be.





The next few minutes were a blur, both physically and emotionally. You weren't sure what was going on, but you think you were having a panic attack. Once it ended and you lay on your side, even more exhausted then you were before, and your throat sore from screaming. On the positive note, your tantrum left you feeling emotionally numb for a while, so a bit more able to assess your situation.

You attempt to stand up. You immediately fall over, pathetically, having made the mistake of trying to stand with only your hind legs. Next you try to stand on all four legs, like an animal. A bit wobbly, but it works, and feels natural. Once you feel stable, you try flexing the limbs on your back. No effects, other then knocking off balance, but you do hear the ruffling of feathers. Wings, perhaps? Why the hell would you have wings?

Your first objective, you decide, is to find some way to get an actual look at your new body. Perhaps your reflection in a mirror, or a lake. You walk into the forest, beginning your trek. You fall down a bit trying to walk at first, but eventually you get the hang of it.

Eventually you come across some marsh/swamplands. Not exactly a lake, but it'll do.

You look down into the murky water, and see your new self for the first time. Your heart rises at what you see, as if you were almost tempted to laugh at this cruel twist of fate you've been sentenced to. You recognized your form. Even though there were some differences from the version you'd seen on TV, you knew exactly what you were.

You were a pony. An orange, MLP-style pegasus.




That settles it, you must be dreaming. You've had dreams like this before, but they've never been so vivid! You've heard lucid dreams like this can get this vivid, to the point of feeling like out-of-body experiences, but you've never actually tried them. Now that you're experiencing one for the first time, you're excited! Imagine all the things you could do!

You composed yourself. You had no idea how long this dream state would last. You had to make every choice carefully to maximize your enjoyment, or you may miss out on the opportunity of a lifetime.

You looked around the forest. Could this be Equestria? This forest- no, jungle- around you could theoretically be the Everfree Forest, though you see no defining landmarks. This is definitely not the part of Equestria you want to see. You had to find some way out of here, or at least find something interesting.

With no landmarks to travel by, you decided you were left with two options. Either head east along the edge of the swamp, which will at least lead you to the outer edges of the forest, or head west, which seems like it will bring you to the innter reaches of the forest.

It all comes down to a question you've probably already heard a thousand times before- which direction do you want to go?
1111.title: Wake-up Call!

11111.content:
You might've explored the forest, but after being unconscious for a day and a half you were starving, and whatever explosion had caused the crater had also covered you in cuts and lacerations. You were a bit numb to the pain once you woke up, but now that your consciousness is returning to you, you're were really starting to feel the pain. You definitely needed some help. Maybe you'd even find one of the characters you've always wanted to meet.

You started walking east along the edge of the swamp. You were getting better at walking, but you still had to limp and were extremely slow, so your journey took what seemed like half an hour. Eventually, though, the dense jungle thinned out a little bit, and you began getting glimpses of far-away small wooden buildings through the trees. You perked up. You were worried this dream might just consist of the boring jungle, but it seems your luck was looking up for once.

You stood on a hill, deep enough in the shrubbery that nobody outside would be able to see you but far enough so you would be able to see out. You wanted to plan out your next move carefully. Once again, your luck didn't fail you. The two buildings closest to what you were now sure was the Everfree ▼


http://sollitudialbacklash.pbworks.com/f...

were two buildings you were pretty sure you recognized. To your left was a large ridiculously overdecorated tower of a building, which you vaguely recognized as the Carousel Boutique, where one of the main characters on the show lived, or at least worked. To your right was a building that you, at first, mistook for a large tree, as it's roof seemed to be layered in leaves and shrubbery. You recognized it as the cottage of Fluttershy, another character.

To which building should you go?
11111.title: Heading into Town

111111.content:
You decided to go toward the Carousel Boutique, While going after Fluttershy seemed much better idea, there isn't guarantee that she is there or just being busy feeding her animals

Of course, this is assuming that Rarity is in the Boutique working but it was more likely that she is somewhere else too. You shock your head not thinking in that. You needed help which is a priority.

Limping toward the overdecorated tower, you found it kind of awkward and painful in doing this in four hooves but once again, it felt natural in this new body of yours, You don't know much of your wings thought.

Arriving to building's main door, you knock on it multiple times hoping that the alabaste mare is in ther to recieve your wounded self.
111111.title: The Carousel Boutique

choices: Twilight and Fluttershy in Fluttershy's cottage
Twilight and somepony else in another place.
111112.content:
As you make your way to Fluttershy's cottage you had a run-in with a Timberwolf. It growled and you just froze for a few seconds before a very loud voice rang in your head "RUN!!!" You took your own advice and ran as fast as you could. But that Timberwolf was faster than you. It pinned you down and was about to have a snack before you saw a blast of magic come and drive the Timberwolf away. You were so scared by that experience that you passed out from exhaustion. After a few hours you woke up to two VERY familiar voices.


Which two voices do you hear?
111112.title: Fluttershy's Cottage

choices: ... finally see a small hut in the distance.
... hear something crashing through the tree canopy.
11112.content:
With no way of knowing which direction leads where, you choose to go west along the river at random and hope it's the right direction. As you walk further, the foliage only get thicker, until the tree canopy blocks out the sky. By the time you realize you were going the wrong way, it was already too late to go back, as dusk was just around the corner. You could only push on and hope you found something before it got too late.

You walked for a while, the forest growing more dark and ominous with every passing minute, until you...
11112.title: Heading deeper into the forest

choices: Stay there and wait for help
Try to make it out of the forest on foot
111122.content:
Just as you started thinking of settling down and building some kind of shelter for the night, your thoughts were interrupted by a piercing scream erupting from above the tree canopy. You immediately braced yourself for a fight as you hear something burst through the canopy of tree leaves, branches snapping under its weight as it descends.

You were expecting some kind of airborne beast to come crashing down on you, but to your relief, the form you were seeing was just another pony. It was a pegasus that had apparently crash landed into the forest, and was now hanging limply as the strange jumpsuit it was wearing got snagged on a tree branch. As you got closer, you recognized the unnatural bright blue hues of its fur and the rainbow pattern of its mane. You paused, not believing your luck. It was Rainbow Dash!

She groaned, still stunned from her fall. She was covered in bruises, with one severe wound on her front leg and both wings looking completely broken. She didn't seem to be fully conscious.

"Hey! Do you need some help?" You yell, trying to knock her out of whatever stupor the crash had fallen her into.

She came to immediately. "What...? Oh, haha... that was quite a crash..." She groaned, and wriggled against the tree branch she was hanging from, tearing her jumpsuit to pieces and causing her to fall to the ground. You run over to her.

"Are you okay?"

"Yeah, yeah, I'm fine..." She grumbled, and attempt to stand up, only to squeal as a tinge of agony bolted through her wounded leg and to fall back to the ground. "Ok, ok, I might need a little help."

You help her to a little clearing, and she sits down on a log that had been placed down horizontally, taking a moment to get her bearings. Judging from the scraps of litter everywhere, and the makeshift firepit in the middle of the clearing, it seems somebody had been using it as a campsite long ago.

You clump some grass into a small pile in the fire pit. Then you press a small, sturdy stick against a wooden plank and start rolling it back and forth in your hooves. You figure it would be nearly impossible with these clunky new hooves, but to your surprise, you get a burning ember within seconds. What the hell kind of wood is this?

You drop the ember into the tinder nest, and spend the next half hour working on it until you get a decent fire going. Just in time, too- it was pitch black outside. Content with your work, you walked over to the little log chair and sat down next to the pegasus, the both of you relaxing by the campfire.

"Thanks for being such a big help, kid. I just about went unconscious after that crash, and I don't think I ever would've woken up if you hadn't come along." Rainbow remarked.

"Think nothing of it." You said dismissively, but you couldn't hide your smile as you fed more grass into the fire pit.

"What were you doing all the way out here in the Everfree, anyway? Don't you know how dangerous it is?" She quizzed.

"I can handle myself." You replied, dodging the question.

She chuckled. "I can see that."

"So, does anybody know that you're out here?" You queried, getting down to business.

"Uh... no, not really. I didn't tell anybody where I was going, I was just flying randomly about. I doubt anypony has any idea where I am." She said, going a little pale as the severity of her situation dawns on her.

"So, we're not going to be getting any search parties coming around here, then?"

"Doubt it."

You sigh. "That's fine. I think I know the way out of this forest, anyway. We just have to head east along that river back there."

"Oh? How long's the trip?"

"Umm... I don't know. A few hour's walk at the very least."

Instead of speaking, she just gestures to the massive wound in her leg. You groan, seeing what she meant. No way she was going to be walking around with an injury like that. Plus, if it goes untreated for too long, she was definitely going to die from either infection or bloodloss.

The way you see it, you have two possibilities if you both want to make it out of the forest alive, both with an equally low chance of working out...
111122.title: Meeting Rainbow Crash

choices: ... an odd, worn-out shack in the middle of the forest.
... a small band of strange ponies, wandering the Everfree.
1111221.content:
"Let's just wait here. Maybe a search party will come by."

"Are you sure? I doubt anypony will find us. The Everfree forest is huge."

"That may be true, but it's our only option." You said, staring into the campfire, trying to figure out how you're going to get out of this mess. You could just leave her behind and walk back to town yourself, but you don't think you could live with yourself if you did that. As you sat there, you noticed Dash wobble a bit, her eyes fluttering and her breathing labored. "What's wrong? Do you feel lightheaded?"

"I'm fine, I'm f-f-fine..." She groans dismissively, not being able to help stuttering as she talks.

You sigh, standing back up on your hooves. "No, you're not," you insist, looking her dead in the eye. "You're bleeding out."

She grimaces, looking down at her foreleg. Her wound couldn't even be seen anymore through all the blood that was coating her leg. The cut must've gone much deeper then you had thought.

"What can we do?"

You think about it for a minute. You know of one thing you can do, but it's risky. If you mess it up, it would make her wound even worse. It seems like it's your only option now, though.

"With a hot enough tool, we can seal the wound shut. No more bleeding."

"Won't that hurt?"

You grimace. "Yeah. It'll hurt like hell. But with a wound like that, we don't have a choice." You give her a reassuring jab to the shoulder. "But you're tough, aren't ya? You can handle it."

She recomposes herself as well as she could, giving a small nod. "Yeah. Yeah, I can," she says under her breath, with a semblance of a smile. "So, what do we have to do?"

You start sorting through the nearby litter. "Just lay back and brace yourself."

You grab some scrap metal from the litter around the campsite and heat one end in the fire until it's almost red hot. You walk over to Rainbow Dash, who was lying on her back in the dirt, her injured forehoof propped up against the log, her eyes squeezed shut.

"You sure you know what you're doing?"

"Yeah, of course I do." You assured her, even though you honestly had no idea. "Just control your breathing and bite down on something. You'll be fine."

She took a deep breath as you edged the utensil closer to the wound.

------------------


You sighed, looking at the pegasus who was sleeping in the dirt beside you, illuminated by the nearby fireplace. Her wound looked even more disgusting now, but at least it wasn't bleeding anymore. The cauterization was fairly successful, you suppose, but you couldn't get the sizzling sound out of your mind. She wasn't lying when she said she was tough- you probably cringed more then she did. After the cauterization, you cleaned her wound as best you could and wrapped a scrap of what was left over of her torn-up jumpsuit around some of it as a makeshift bandage, before letting her get some much-needed rest.

You looked up at the stars, lying on your back. You suppose you should sleep as well, but you just couldn't no matter how hard you tried. You sighed, getting to your hooves. You suppose you should use this time to look for supplies or shelter instead of just wasting it.

You wander off into the trees, making sure to remember where you are, as it's very easy to get lost in a forest as dense as the Everfree. After a few minutes of walking, you see in the distance...
1111221.title: Don't Try This at Home

choices: Go out to try and find enough food for both of you
Stay at the house and try to call for help
11112211.content:
You spent about ten minutes of walking through the Everfree, strictly in a rigid straight line (so that if you wanted to go back to the campsite you would just turn around). Just as you're about to turn back, you manage to spot a small structure in the distance. You silently trod up towards it, hoping not to attract the attention of whoever might be inside.

As you get closer, you get a few good glimpses of it through the trees. It seemed to be a house built into a large, ragged tree, with various ornaments and bottles hanging from its limbs, clattering ominously in the breeze. Finally you get close enough to peer through a window and scan the interior of the house. It seemed much larger on the inside then it looked on the outside. You recognize the place immediately by the strange masks and large cauldron in the center. This must be Zecora's place, although she doesn't seem to be home right now.

You rush back towards the camp with a smile on your face.

---

Thirty minutes later, you entered back into the clearing where the tree house was, helping Rainbow Dash hobble along with you, sleep still in her eyes. She had her injured leg propped up on your back, almost using you as a crutch. A semblance of a smile creeped on her face as she gazed upon the house.

"Hey, I know this place. This is Zecora's house," she noted, sleepily.

You played the fool. "Are you sure? It doesn't look like anybody lives here to me," You say as you push the door open with your side, the both of you stepping inside.

"She's probably just out," she remarked.

You walked her over to the little wooden bed in the corner, with a patterned blanket that looked like it was made out of animal hides. She lays down on her back with a sigh of relief, snuggling into the covers.

"Thank Celestia, an actual bed," she smiled. "I was getting tired of sleeping on that log."

As she got settled in, you moved the massive cauldron in the middle of the house aside and started a fire on the coals there.

"That should keep the house warm for the night," you explain, to no one in particular. You smile as you see Dash already curled up on the bed, asleep. Exhaustion finally setting up, you lie on your back on the uncomfortable wooden floor next to the fire, and drift to sleep.

---

Six hours later hours later, you're awoken by the sound of your own stomach grumbling.

"Urrgghh..." You groan as you pull yourself to your hooves. You rubbed the sleep out of your eyes as you looked out the window, listening to the sound of birds singing far above you. You had more then enough water around the house to keep thirst at bay, but you hadn't eaten in a while. Then again, going out into the extremely dangerous Everfree forest to find something to eat was probably a terrible idea. Perhaps you should stay at the house with Dash and try to see if you can get help.
11112211.title: Zecora's Shack

choices: Further treat Rainbow's wound to buy some time
Start another fire to signal any rescue teams
111122112.content:
You look out into the dense jungle, listening to the sounds of the wildlife. You figured you would get lost easily if you went to try and find food, and with your new smaller, scrawnier body, if you had an run-ins with some timberwolves or anything, you'd be doomed. Might as well stay at the house and do all you can here.

Water isn't a problem. There was dozens of bottles full of various liquids littering the shelves of the house. You just had to pray that emergency rescue teams can find you before Rainbow succumbs to exposure or the both of you succumb to hunger. You should start thinking about what you were going to do while you wait.
111122112.title: Staying home

1111221121.content:
You sigh, giving up on the prospect of gathering food despite the complaints of your empty belly. You walk back into the house, making the decision that treating Rainbow's wound was a more pressing issue. You see her still on the rickety bed, stirring from the slumber with a yawn.

"Good morning," you greet, sorting through the various potions on the shelves.

"Mornin'," she smiles groggily, stretching.

"Are you feeling all right?"

"I've been better," she replies snarkily, before recoiling upon getting a look at her leg wound. "Ugh. Looks even worse now."

You get a glance at her wound, cringing slightly upon seeing it. It had turned from charred grey and red to an even more disgusting black and puke green.

"Yeah, cauterization opens you up to major infection pretty quick," you say matter-of-factly, looking over all the potions you could find that were actually labelled.

Her eyes widened at the information. Perhaps you could've broken it to her a tad more lightly. "What?" she gasped, "Then why the tartarus did you do it, then!?"

"If I didn't, you'd be dead by now," you insist. "Relax, it's not that big a deal. There's probably some medical supplies around here somewhere."

Eventually, you find a small, cylindrical bottle with a viscous red liquid inside. On the label, in sloppy handwriting, was 'PUNCTURES & FRACTURES'. You pull the spongy cork out with your teeth, taking a whiff of the bottle's contents. Smelled like some kind of mixture of garlic, ginger, and some other things.

"This should probably do it," you say, tossing the bottle onto the bed in front of her.

She looks down at it, quizzically. "Am I supposed to drink it or...?"

"Uh, sure. It's a potion, right?"

She reluctantly presses it to her lips and leans her head back, taking in the liquid in a single gulp. She immediately tosses the bottle to the floor, coughing viciously.

"Yuck! What was in that thing?"

"Don't know. The label didn't say."

With nothing else to do, you went outside to start up another fire on front lawn of the house so that you can better signal any search parties that traveled over the Everfree by sky. You walked back into the house a half hour later to find Dash fiddling with the empty bottle on her bed with abject boredom.

"Hey. You feeling alright?"

"Yeah, my legs not so sore anymore," she said, bending her foreleg back and forth quickly to demonstrate. Man, potions work fast. "Hey, did you get any food out there? I'm running on empty over here."

"Nope, sorry. There's no food around here."

"Ugh!" Rainbow groaned, reeling back on the bed in frustration.

You chuckle, and relax on the floor, taking some time to analyze your new body. You flap your wings as fast as you could, just to see what would happen, but no matter how hard you tried, you couldn't lift yourself an inch. Soaring through the air like Rainbow Dash seems to do with ease must take a baffling amount of strength.

As you lounge around the house, looking at the interesting masks decorating the walls, Rainbow Dash peers at you from the bed. She looked like she wanted something.

"Uh... hey?"

You turned away from the masks, turning to her. "Yep?"

"Are you going to be doing anything for the next couple... hours?"

"Well, at this point we're pretty much just waiting for help to arrive, so no," you reply, trotting over to her.

"Oh good. I haven't eaten in days, and I feel like I'm about to keel over."

"I understand, but I told you, if I go scavenging for food I'll be ripped to pieces by the wildlife."

"I know, I know! I'm just saying, maybe you can fill my belly for a few hours? Y'know, until help arrives?" She asks, as if it wasn't a big deal.

You stare at her for a while, processing what she had said. "Uh... what?"

"I normally wouldn't ask this of strangers, but I'm starving. And starving probably isn't good for the whole 'staying alive' thing," she shrugs.

"Are you... are you asking if you can eat me?" you choke out.

"Uh, yeah. What's wrong, never been eaten before?" She looks at you with a strange expression on her face, before appearing to have some sort of realization. "... oh Celestia, have you just been living out here in the Everfree alone your whole life?"

"Uh... yes?" you lie, ceasing the opportunity.

"Oh jeez, kid, I'm so sorry. That must've sounded so weird," she apologized, before tapping the spot on the bed next to her with her hoof, insistently. "C'mon over here, I can explain."

You sit down next to her on the bed, awkwardly. You desperately wanted to tell her you weren't a 'kid'- you were actually in your 20's back on Earth- but decide that it would be too hard to explain.

"Well, uh, when the monsters out here in the Everfree eat you, you die, right? Because they're carnivores?"

You nod.

"But if a pony swallows another pony, they won't die, because ponies aren't carnivores. We can't digest meat."

You nod, again, not fully comprehending what she was saying.

"So, back in Ponyville- uh, that's the town I'm from- many ponies frequently swallow other ponies, for fun, or because they made them mad, or whatever. And keep them in their bellies for a little while," she explained, gesturing towards her stomach.

"... so... okay then...?" you reply, confused. "But if you don't digest me at all, how would eating me make you any less hungry?"

"Umm... I'm actually not sure how that works. It just works, ok? I'm not a scientist," she shrugs. "So, are you up for it, or what?"

She must've been really, desperately hunger to ask you for something like this. Even moreso to have bothered taking the time to explain it all to you. The self-preservation side of you is screaming at you to say 'no, its too risky', but something about being curled up inside the mare's belly was just so alluring to you. What do you say?
1111221121.title: A Strange Proposition

11112211211.content:
"You're... you're being serious?" you ask, a flurry of conflicting emotions ravaging your brain.

"One hundred percent serious. C'mon, it'll only be a few hours!" she said, nearly begging you. You just now noticed that she had been scooting closer and closer to you this entire time, until she was almost brushing up against your side.

You stared at her belly as it released another loud, ominous growl. Many of the expected emotions were flying through your head- disgust and confusion, mostly- but they overpowered by a much greater sense of excitement. You were... intoxicated, by the simple thought of being stowed inside the mare's stomach, tucked away from the world. You didn't know why it had such an effect on you, but you could hardly see straight. There was something about how impossible it seemed to be, and how casual she was about it. It felt like a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.

"And... I'll fit? My entire body, in your stomach? And it won't hurt?"

"It might be a bit uncomfortable, but I won't hurt you," she promised. "And you'll fit, trust me. I've done this before."

You grimace. You were long past the point of saying 'no', she had convinced you. Might as well get it over with.

"... a-alright. I trust you. You can... swallow me," you breathe, placing emphasis on the 'swallow', almost savoring the word.

"Attaboy!" she smiled, rustling your mane with one hoof and pulling you up to her with her other one. "Trust me, it'll be uncomfortable at first, but after a while it'll get really relaxing."

"Ok... so, uh, what do I have to do?" you asked, a bit of nervousness showing in your voice and eyes.

She chuckled. "Eager, are you? I'll ease you into it. You'll know just what to do. But before that..." she smirked, before leaning back on the bed, presenting her soft, rotund furry belly to you. "Why don't you and my belly get a little bit more well acquainted, since you're going to be in there for a while? I'm thinking a nice belly rub will do the trick. Let it know someone's comin' in."

You stared down at her belly, your eyes wide. You wanted to ask if she was serious, but you could no longer choke out the words. You pushed your hooves down on her belly, kneading the woolly flesh, feeling her malleable, supple gut mold under your hooves. She wriggled like a cat, giggling, as you massaged her tummy. She was more slim and muscular then pudgy, so it would be a tight fit, but you were now completely certain that you would be able to fit all the way inside of her. You pressed an ear against her belly, listening as it gurgles loudly, begging for something to fill it up.

She suddenly used her wings to propel herself forwards, tackling you. Before you knew what hit you, you were on your back on the bed, the larger pegasus pinning you down. She had her full weight on your forelegs, restraining you, which was kind of painful, but you were far too enchanted to complain. The mare licked her lips slowly and dramatically, and you got a few moment's glimpse of her moist, yawning throat, quietly beckoning to you.

"Well aren't you a tasty little treat?" she smirked. You could tell that she knew she had you under her full power. She could do anything to you, and you wouldn't be able to resist, nor would you want to. She could tell you to do anything, and you would without hesitation.

She pulled you up to her, her warm breath pelting your faith as she lulled her tongue from her maw. She sent it along your cheek, behind your ear, tickling the back of your neck, taking in your flavor. The sound of your heart thumping in your chest boomed in your ears. The moment was so surreal, you didn't even notice as she sent her tongue along the scruff of your chest and down along your own belly. It wasn't until you felt her tongue slide along your inner thigh that you recoiled by reflex.

She looked up at you, giving a little smirk, her messy hair draped over your hind legs. "What are you so tense about? It's just you and me out here," she chuckled. "Just relax. Don't you trust me?"

Your new body was so much more sensitive then your human body was, especially when adrenaline was pumping through your veins. The simple sensation of the faint breeze flowing over your skin was enough to send shivers down your spine. So feeling the mare of your dreams slick her tongue over your glans was ecstasy. Your member sprung erect embarrassingly fast. She arched her back instinctively, bobbing her rump in the air opposite you, as she toyed with your most sensitive area. but how? that was your question and who would help a human? somehow you didn't notice the building in front of you, you look up of it and it was...
112.title: Human

choices: She'd found a quick fix spell she could perform right away.
She'd found a powerful incantation, but it would days to prepare.
1121.content:
The Ponyville library! Perfect, you thought. If anyone is going to know how to set this right its Twilight Sparkle, and honestly, she'd probably be the most willing to help, if only out of pure curiosity. With that in mind, you began to make your way towards the library's front door, which shouldnt have been as daunting a task as it was now, given your height.

The walk from the small grassy outcropping to the library was harrowing to say the least. It was actually some time in the mid to late evening and the dirt path leading to the door was not well lit. Strange sounds were all around you and if getting stepped on had never been a fear of yours before, it certainly was now. All it would take was some strolling pony to put a hoof wrong in the dark and your journey here would be over. You picked your way carefully towards your destination, occasionally tripping over small stones with your clumsy new height. You're stride was meant for someone much bigger and you had not adapted well to walking at this size. After a good few minutes of careful walking and occasional tripping, you found yourself at the foot of the door. Now the next big task, getting the attention of someone inside.

Thinking quickly, you found a sizeable stone and raised it above your head to slam it on the door. The resulting thud seemed to echo quite loudly inside and before long you could hear movement. Hoofsteps began coming towards the door. Success! You continued knocking, just to be sure.

"Alright, alright!" A voice grumbled from inside."Sheesh its getting to a point where a pony cant get a lick of sleep around here..."

The latch on the door began to open and suddenly you realized the door opens outwards. As it swung open, the edge of the door caught you square in the chest, throwing you against the doorframe and pinning you there. Terrific...

Twilight Sparkle poked her head out of the door and looked out into the night, confused and searching for the source of the knocking that had woken her from a particularly well deserved slumber.

"Hello?" She called out, but heard no reply. "If this is somepony playing tricks, you really need to pick a better one...or at least do it when ponies arent sleeping." To which something replied.

"ow..."

"What? What was that?" Twilight looked frantically about. She was certain that was a voice, however faint.

"Down here..." You managed to cough out, attempting to push the heavy door away from your chest. Twilight brought her head to level with yours, her lavender eyes catching the moonlight and practically glowing. Or maybe they were glowing, she was magical after all.

"Oh my goodness, Im so sorry about hitting you with the door...I had no idea you were there!" She said apologetically

"Its fine" You said, cracking your back and and feeling as though several bones just snapped back in to place."Im just glad you heard me."

"You make quite a lot of noise for someone so small." She smiled. "How can I help?" Just like Twilight to be so accepting and willing to help, you thought and smiled back.

"Well, as you might have guessed, Im a human, and until just recently I was quite a bit..." Before you could finish, you caught the confused look on Twilights face.

"You're a what?" She replied quizzically.

"A human. You know...homo...oh what is it....homosapien! Thats it!" You proclaimed proudly, but felt slightly less so when you saw she still clearly had no idea what you were talking about. You sighed. It made sense, you didnt remember there ever having been a human so much as mentioned in the show. "Look, the point is...until just a few...I dont know. hour ago I guess, I was not this size, age, or far from my home. And I came here because I..." You thought about how to phrase this best. Explaining that you knew about her from a television show would have just come off as gibberish, and you were pretty Twilight, while sufficiently intrigued, was having a hard time grasping just what you were. "I had heard from travelling ponies you were the one to talk to when it came to magical problems, so here I am." You finished and braced yourself for what she would say. Twilight was now sitting on her haunches, looking inquisitively at you as you finished your explanation. She smiled again and nodded.

"Well I certainly appreciate good rumours of my skills. Still I've never heard of a human before. Where do you come from? You said you were a long way from home. Did you come all this way just to find me?"

"To be honest, I dont know how I got here. But I knew where here was when I did and I was lucky enough to recognize your library. So can you help me?" Twilight thought for a moment and then rose to her feet. She turned back to the library and motioned for you to follow.

The two of you walked in to the massive tree that contained the Ponyville library. Well, massive to you at any rate.

"I dont know...most of my spells are tailored to ponykind. There are some that are useable on creatures and vegetables and that sort of thing, but I dont know if any of them would be effective on a human." Twilights horn began to glow as books slid from the shelves and floated down around her. She began leafing through the pages of many books at once, seemingly reading all of them. "Hmm...." She grumbled something to herself and dropped a bunch of the books and pulled more down. You began to see where all the mess Spike was usually left cleaning up came from. You found yourself a step ladder to pull yourself onto and sat down. After a few minutes of silent reading, Twilight shot bolt upright and dropped all her books but one. "Here we go, maybe this will work!"
1121.title: Getting some magical help

11211.content:
"It seems pretty simple to perform too. Though I think its usually mean for shrunken ponies..." She looked a bit apprehensive. It was sweet she was concerned about harming you even though she'd just met you.

"Right now, Im willing to try anything!" You said getting to your feet. "What do we have to do?" Twilight propped her spell book up on a podium and read it closely.

"Its just a straight-forward spell, should be easy to cast. You're sure about this though?"

"What have I got to lose? If I dont try Im stuck like this."

"Okay... well, come stand here and I'll give it a whirl." She motioned to the center of the room. You scurried over and stood facing her. Twilight stood behind her podium and started reading aloud from the book. It was inaudible what she was reading but she was intently focussed on it. Her horn began to glow a deep purple and an aura began to spread from it, encasing you in a shell of shimmering light. The light almost seemed to shine right through you as it became brighter and brighter. Almost instantly you could feel yourself growing. You looked down to see the floor getting farther away and your limbs getting longer.

"Its working!" You shouted, looking back to Twilight. Suddenly your attitude changed. Twilight was clearly in pain. Her eyes were clenched tightly and tears were visible in the corners, and she continued reading the spell from memory through clenched teeth. You went to shout to her, to ask her to stop but it was too late. A final blast of light engulfed the room and knocked you off your feet, as well as most of the books from their shelves.

When the smoke finally cleared you found yourself on your knees in a corner of the room, some several feet from where you had been standing. And there. on the other side of the room, was Twilight, unconscious, and looking very worse for ware. You ran to her side, crossing the room in a flash, which caught you off guard for a moment. You checked yourself again and found that you were regular sized again! Well, for the younger self that you were, but it was still an improvement over the rat size you had been earlier.

"Twilight! It worked, well mostly, but Im a normal size now!" You cheered, but Twilight didnt stir. She lay still on the floor. Suddenly you began to panic, and leaned down to her mouth. Faintly you could hear breathing, she was alive but it was only just. "Twilight?! Oh no! What do I do?!"

"Hey! What the heck happened here?!" A shrill voice called from behind. You spun around to see Spike on the staircase. "And who the heck are you? Also, what the heck are you?" At a loss for words you stuttered and rose to your feet, revealing Twilight on the floor behind you. "Twilight!" Spike cried and ran to her side. "What did you do?!"

"I..it...she...it was a spell, I needed help and...she said it was simple." You managed to stammer out. Spike pushed his way past you and hopped up on to the podium. The spell book Twilight had been using somehow had not been even remotely affected by the explosion. Spike quickly read the spell and gasped. He ran back to Twilights side.

"Twilight! Why did you try and do that? You knew that was a dangerous spell. You talked about how tricky that book was all the time!"

"But...she said it was simple..." You sank to your knees, Had you just killed Twilight Sparkle?

No! You were not letting this happen!

"Spike!" You shouted with a fervour that made him jump "Which way to the hospital?" You rushed to Twilight and did your best to lift her on to your shoulders in a weird piggy-back kind of way. It wasnt easy but you got her off the ground and began to follow Spike out of the library and into the night.

To Twilight, the night had been mostly a blur. She vaguely remembered someone coming to her door, someone she couldnt see at first...why couldnt she see him? Then there was some talking and even though she couldnt put a face to the words, something about the voice made her feel happy. He seemed nice, and was well mannered for someone who had been banging on her door in the middle of the night. Then searching through the library...human...a strange word that kept floating in her head... what did human mean? Then she heard her own voice, she was reading something, Then there was a searing pain and blinding light, and then Twilight woke up.

You and Spike had not left Twilights side for days now. Since the night you arrived on the hospital doorstep with her on your back, begging for help, you had been there, waiting for her wake up. Twilights injuries had been serious, but thanks to the speed in which you had arrived, she was well taken care of and was expected to recover fully, even if that meant she spent several days sleeping. The doctors assured you she would be fine, but you were intent on staying with her so the hospital had taken you in and let you stay there while Spike went about letting ponies know what had happened. There you met Twilights friends, and the Princesses in this time, though only briefly. Princess Celestia had even taken you aside to speak with you personally.

"I dont know where you came from, but I am grateful you were able to get my pupil here with such haste. Spike would not have been able to manage on his own, and I fear any other help would have been too late." She gave you a courteous bow. "But I must ask who you are and how you came to be in Twilights home that night." And so you explained as best you could. still leaving out the parts about having seen all this in a show before. You claimed to be from a far off land, which wasnt entirely untrue, and that by some force of magic you had found yourself in Ponyville and Twilight had been kind enough to help you. Celestia smiled and looked back to her student, who lay silently in a hospital bed, surrounded by her friends. "She is a kind hearted pony, so willing and eager to help those in need. I am glad she was able to assist you, and even though she did so at great harm to herself, which I will be speaking to her about when she recovers, I feel that all of this has happened for a reason, so allow me to officially welcome you to Equestria, and I promise we will do our best to discover what has happened to you."

That night, you were quietly falling asleep in the chair you had occupied by Twilights bed for days now, when she gasped and sat up, dazed and confused.
11211.title: The Quick Fix

112111.content:
She threw her hooves around you the moment you came within reach, hugging you close. "Mr. Human! You're big again. I'm so glad."

Caught off guard, you could think to do nothing else but return the embrace.

Eventually Twilight let you go, but still held onto your hand to keep you from leaving. Spike returned from his trip to the bathroom and he too embraced the mare. After that the new friends caught Twilight up on what had happened, to which she looked very guilty, especially under the disapproving glare Spike had been giving her. You also introduced yourself as Anonymous. The doctors soon came in and gave Twilight one last check up, saying that all seemed well and that she should be ready to leave tomorrow, to which all three of you were happy to hear.

Overcome with relief, you decide to take a stroll around the hospital. Since the incident the first night, Rarity had generously offered to make you a new set of clothes to match your unique physique. It had been an odd experience as Rarity had been rather insistent on making the pants crotchless, arguing that leaving such an area open would help integrate him into the normally nude Equestrian society. He eventually conceded, though still found it awkward. When ponies would stare at him, he had to remind himself that they were more curious about him being a different species than staring at his groin, though he still caught their eyes wandering.

Stopping first at a snack dispenser, you are approached by a mare you recognize as Nurse Redheart.

"Hello, Mr. Anonymous."

"Hey. You hear the good news?"

"Twilight's awake," she said with a smile. "Wonderful news, indeed. But on that note, there's something the medical staff and I have been wondering."

"Oh?"

"There is nothing in any of our records about humans, let alone their physiology," she began. "I don't know where you're from and not even you know how you got here. Since we can't contact your homeland, from a medical perspective, we're effectively on our own if something happens to you."

"Oh..." you grimaced at the logic in her words.

"With that in mind, would you consent to a medical examination?" At your tensing in worry, she gave a reassuring smile. "There's no need to fret. Our magical scans are completely non-invasive. We'll have a look inside you, collect a few samples like hair and saliva," she then mumbled something too softly for you to hear, "and we'll be good."

"How long will it take?"

"We'll need to do a few sessions over a period of days, but I can't see any one session lasting more than an hour." Her eyes glanced below your belt before looking back up. "Just think it over." And with that, she turned and away, flicking her tail off to the side and giving you a clear view of what lay beneath.

Thinking it over, you agreed that what she said had made sense. At the same time, you couldn't help but wonder if she might have some ulterior motivation. In the end, you agree to the examination and rush to catch up with her.

How does it go?

It had been quite the hullabaloo when word got out. Spoiled Rich was hardly discrete, especially given that she was still reeling in the throws of passion days later, but at least she kept the secret on a need-to-know basis. When her husband, Filthy Rich found out, he was not nearly as surprised as one might expect. He’d always known that his wife was quite the slut, so he’d long figured that this day was inevitable. The only unexpected part was that she’d get knocked up by another mare.

However, that actually made things a lot easier. Ponies had a generally polyamorous culture. The monogamy of a single mare and stallion were actually quite rare. Given the sexual disparity of mares outnumbering stallions roughly four to one, it was only sensible that marriages would be arranged so that one stallion could be reserved to service multiple mares. As such, in order to avoid a scandal, the simplest solution for all parties involved was simply to have Rarity marry into the riches.

It really was the ideal arrangement. Rarity finally got a suave and dashing gentle stallion to call her own, Spoiled got a dick that she was head over hooves in lust with, and Filthy got a chance to explore some of the fetishes he’d been keeping secret.

Their wedding was lovely, especially given how rushed it had been.

Now Rarity was living out of Rich Manor, though she still worked at Carousel Boutique. Diamond Tiara was now the marshmallow mare’s daughter. And though she was a brat at first, Rarity quickly found ways to keep her line. Sweetie was certainly happy to no longer be bullied, plus she was overjoyed at her impending status as an aunt. Things have settled down for the most part. Spoiled’s pregnancy is showing more and more every day and Rarity has adjusted well to the life of luxury she’d always fantasized about.

112312112112121112222222221221.content:
You feel your entire body shaking as the horn of the shaded figure starts glowing green. The green light starts to intensify and brighten the entire stomach. With the chamber lit, you can gaze upon who's in the stomach with you can feel a cold shiver going down your spine, for sitting before you is none other than the terrifying queen of the changelings, Queen Chrysalis. Chrysalis senses your fear and places both for her forelegs on your shoulders, pulling you into an embrace.

"Calm down, I did say that I wasn't going to hurt." You do remember the dark figure saying that and calm down ever so slightly. A question soon comes to your mind.

"C-Chrysalis, w-what are you doing h-here?" Chrysalis pulls back slightly to look you in the eye.

"Do you mean, 'what am I doing here' as in Ponyville or 'what am I doing here' as in this mare's stomach? Either way, it's a long story."

"Well... I don't think we're really going anywhere, so you might as well tell me." The changeling queen nods at this.

"Very well, I might as well to do it to kill some time. I assume you know about my failed invasion of Equestria?" You slowly nod your head, Chrysalis lets out a sad sigh at this. "Alright, that saves some time. After Cadance and Shining Armor caused that explosion of love energy, my... admittedly poorly planned invasion was foiled and my forces and I were sent flying off. After our defeat, things became much worse for my hive. A large amount changelings died, either from their injuries upon landing or from absorbing so much love energy in the explosion that they were fried. Word quickly spread throughout the world of my attack and defences were quickly raised, making it much more difficult for my changeling to gather the love we needed to survive. Due the my failure leading to much a massive loss of life on our side and making finding food ever more difficult, I was declared an unfit ruler and exiled. A new queen was chosen to replace me, I think her name was Papillon or Vivillon so some such.... Anyhow, I was banished, forced to aimlessly roam the land that I had sought to conquer. Knowing that there were likely search parties trying to find me and other changelings to bring to Celestia for execution, I used my vast knowledge to find a way to eluded any pursuers. I reduced my self to microscopic sized to both avoid detection and so that I would need less nourishment to sustain myself. I eventually made my way to Ponyville and briefly contemplated getting revenge, but I thought there no be no real point in doing so, so I flew around the town and gathered small enough scraps of love energy and solid food to keep me alive. One day, I flew into this bakery feast upon a miniscule section of a freshly baked cupcake. I didn't realize until it was too late that the dessert hadn't be frosted yet, and I soon found myself buried under tons of pink frosting. When I was able to break free of the frosting, I found that I was traveling down this mare's throat and into her stomach. After casting a spell to make me acid proof, I considered escaping, but I eventually decided against that. I had access to all the food, water and love that I could ever need. I manage to make a new home for myself, and I owe it all to... Umm?" She looks at, obviously not know the name of who she's within.

"Cupcake."

"Yes, I am thankful for that dessert, but I want to know the name of the mare I've taken lodge in."

"That is her name, her name is Cupcake." Chrysalis stares at you for a moment.

"... Ponies have really weird names."

"I do admit that some are kinda weird."

"Well, anyway; now that you're here, I could either help you find a method of escape, or you could stay here and become my roommate and friend... possibly with benefits. So which do you choose?"

1123121121121211122222222212212.title: Eating with Chrysalis

11231211211212111222222222122121.content:
As you follow Chrysalis down the tunnel, you see the entrance to the stomach close off, likely to prevent acid damaging any of Cupcake's organs. After a moment of silence, you come up with some questions to ask Chrysalis.

"So, is there any particular reason you decided to make your home in her lungs?" Chrysalis turns her head back to answer.

"The fresh air, for a start."

"Really?"

"Well where else in a pony's body would you find air that doesn't reek of what they've eaten, the bowels?"

"Ehh... Fair point, but wouldn't the nose work too?"

"Perhaps, but then I would constantly worry about being buried in snort. Though I am no a queen and exiled from my homeland, I still some of my dignity and refuse to have such a fate befall me. Besides, there are other benefits to making my hut in her lungs."

"Such as?" You inquire as your eyebrow rises.

"I was able to gain easy access to her bloodstream. I set up a system to extract water from her blood so that I would have plumbing. The difficult part was creating a micro-capillary to that would send any waste to her kidneys and then bladder. Oh, that reminds me, if you want cold water, you either have to wait a while or have me use magic to cool it."

"Huh, that's pretty cool. Does that amount we use have a negative impact of her?"

"I highly doubt it. This Cup Cake is so massive compared to us that the amount of water we could probably use if we had all the faucets turned on for a full day would be likely less than the amount in a single tear." Chrysalis' horn alights as another opening appears in front of you. "We've reached the lung." She calls out as she passes the threshold.

You quickly follow behind her and gasp at the sight before you. You see a seeming endless chamber that formed of landscape of flesh and veins, everything you see expands and contracts quite quickly as air rushes in and out in intervals.

"We'll reach my hut in about five minutes. We'll have to walk though, my spell may keep us on the proverbially ground, but it won't work if we try to fly in here. Trust me, I learned that the hard way. It took me a week and a half to recover from that."

After a few minutes of travel, you spot a the hut that was next to a vein. You guess that Chrysalis wasn't kidding when she said that she made it out of pieces of magic transformative magic because the walls looked like they were made of re velvet cape and the roof made from a large piece of lettuce. You dash past Chrysalis and start feel the building. What looked like cake felt like concrete while the roof felt like plastic.Chrysalis pats you on the back with her wing and guides you inside. The room you were in seemed to be a living room with a out of place sink attached to the wall. The room had a recliner chair next to a small bookshelf with around a dozen books. Next to the sink was a cupboard that likely had whatever Chrysalis had for dishware. You see that there were two doors in the room. Chrysalis was heading the door on the left before she looked back at you.

"The bathroom's on the right if you want to wash up or you the toilet. I'll be in the bedroom, making the bed big enough for the both of us. We'll discuss where you'll be staying in the morning." And with that, she shuts the bedroom door behind you.

Now that you were on your own, you decide to...

You look for something to read. At the moment, you didn't want to look at an extensive or large book; however there was one that was interesting. It was a grey one and seemed small, the title said "Chrysalis' Journey" It was probably the tale in how Chrysalis had come to Cup Cake's Body. You sit down and started to read at a random page.

"It's been weeks since my exile, the news came out fast that a new queen had been elected. She started an alliance with the gryphons right away. The ponies delegation have mixed feelings, but the most... Ironic thing that happen is that a single pony supported the alliance, her name is Twilight... Twilight Sparkle, the sister of Shining Armor, this must be a plot, a deception, she'll never…

Alright, outside of that, I have made some progress. I have fooled the hunting pack of timber wolves in this damnable forest by shrinking down into nearly microscopic level. I found a town, Ponyville. I need to look for love and solid food and at this size, and it will be easier to keep myself nourished enough.

The town seems rather nice; there are many ponies... and a lot of love energies to feed myself and the whole hive for years. Of course at this size it’s a lot, but normal size, it would be nothing. I have given up my wish for revenge, it won't help me in a long run right now, the alliance seems to be prospering and the farms of Love Bloom are active again in the Hive's territories, the Changelings no longer need to raid for slaves of love."


This seems interesting; the book is about Chrysalis’ travels. You look at another random page.

"Eaten... I cannot believe it. I'm not going to point details on how but I was first eating a section of cupcake then trapped, pinned by a veritable mountain of frosting and then... in a stomach, luckily I was able to cast an acid-proof spell on myself. This place is enormous... and it seems that I'm not alone...

Private Anon Lankin wakes up in a field of some sort of field. It sort of reminds him of the countryside of England during his childhood. He wonders where he has been transported to. Just as he gets up, he hears a very American accent behind him.

"Why howdy stranger. You don't look like you're from 'round here." said the voice, which turned out to be a small horse with a cowboy hat.

"Blimey, a talking orange pony!" Anon said in an equally British accent. "And it's American. I must've been transported somewhere there. Those bloody yanks will create the strangest things, will they." you say.

"Um, yeah. All ponies talk 'round here. Ya'll alright stranger?" the pony asks.

"Wait, all horses in America talk? Bloody hell."

"America? What's that? This is Equestria. You're not makin' much sense stranger."

"Equestria? So you mean this is a different world after all? The portal machine worked?"

"The what machine?" the pony said becoming ever more confused by this bipedal creature.

"Well bloody hell then. What's your name strange horse thing?"

"Um. It's Applejack."

"Well than Ms Applejack" Anon said as he picked up his rifle and placed a strange machine onto the ground, "Welcome to the glorious British Empire."

"The British what?" Applejack said, feeling quite concerned at the word empire.

Then Anon's machine opened up a massive portal of light, and out of it came dozens of tanks, soldiers, and planes, all bearing the Union Jack.

The confused Applejack looked and the strange machines and people in horror and confusion. "Wh- what's happening?"

"Don't worry Ms. Applejack," Anon said, "The royal army is here to bring you the wonders of civilization! In return, we just ask for your excess land and resources to aid in the war effort."

"War?! What war?" Applejack says with even more panic in her voice.

"Why the war against the germans of course. We have to defend the empire and the freedom it stands for. Don't worry. Just work with the royal army and everything shall be most spiffing for the both of us."

It was at that moment that Applejack realized that she had just encountered some dangerous creatures. She would have to let the princesses and her friends know back in Canterlot.

You were sitting in you room one night and suddenly without warning, a character from MLP FiM teleports into you room and shoves you in a sac before tossing you through a magic portal. Now you are a ponyfied filly or colt and every mare in Equestria wants you for their own reasons. You can decide who you want to go with.
